Dispute_Type: Dispute over trademark rights and alleged unauthorized use by the defendant
Legal_Issue: Whether Havana House's trademark registrations are valid and if the defendant infringed or passed off the plaintiffs' trademarks
Governing_Law: Sections 7, 16, 18, 19, 20, and 22 of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evidence of harm or unauthorized use
Decision_Outcome: Defendant wins summary judgment; plaintiffs' trademarks invalidated
Burden_of_Proof: Plaintiffs failed to prove validity of trademarks and infringement
Legal_Rule: Trademark use, registration, infringement, and passing off under the Trade-marks Act
Standard_of_Review: Legal principles and statutory provisions applied in summary judgment context
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged trademark infringement and passing off
Outcome_on_Merits: Claims dismissed due to invalidity of trademarks and lack of infringement
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Summary judgment granted in favor of defendant
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation and application of Trade-marks Act
Key_Evidence_Considered: Havana House's role as distributor, lack of distinctiveness in marks
Applicant_Challenge: Defendant challenged validity of plaintiff's trademarks and claims
Defendant_Response: Motion for summary judgment denying infringement and challenging trademark validity
Evidence_Type: Documentary and factual evidence on use and registration of trademarks
Remedy_Requested: Invalidation of trademarks, dismissal of infringement claims
Claimant_Status: Plaintiffs (Havana House) as alleged trademark owners
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Invalid trademark registration, lack of distinctiveness, no passing off
Outcome_of_Review: Defendant successful in having claims dismissed
Governing_Rule: Trade-marks Act provisions on registration, use, infringement, and passing off
